decision_conditions: Insufficient information has been provided to prove on the balance of probabilities that the operations applied for (consisting of the use of the car parking spaces at units B12, B13 and B14 for the siting of a container and a freezer, and the erection of a means of enclosure (boundary fence)) have occurred for the relevant periods to have been immune from enforcement action or otherwise lawful at the time of the application. Consequently, under the unambiguous wording of s191(4), officers recommend that the certificate of lawful development for the existing operations must be refused.

Upon review of evidence available to the Local Planning Authority, it is clear that enforcement action could have been taken against the operations applied for (consisting of the use of the car parking spaces at units B12, B13 and B14 for the siting of a container and a freezer, and the erection of a means of enclosure (boundary fence)) at the time of the application. Consequently, under the unambiguous wording of s191(4), officers recommend that the certificate of lawful development for the existing operations must be refused.
description: Certificate of Lawfulness for the existing use of the car parking spaces at units B12, B13 and B14 for: the siting of a container and a freezer; and the erection of a means of enclosure (boundary fence).
